Multivariate Outlier Detection

Source: R/multiOutliers.R
multiOutliers.Rd

Identifies multivariate outliers using four different methods.

Usage

multiOutliers(
  data,
  varlist = names(data),
  method,
  minPts = 10,
  k = 5,
  threshold = 0.95,
  alpha = 0.1,
  ntrees = 100,
  n = 5,
  na.rm = TRUE,
  ...
)

Arguments

data

a data frame

varlist

a list of numeric variables

method

character, supplies the method to be used for outlier detection. Methods are LoF, kNN, mahalanobis, and iForest

minPts

(optional) numeric, minimum points used for LoF outlier detection. Default value is 5

k

(optional) a k value used for the kNN method of outlier detection. Default value is 5

threshold

(optional) the threshold used for kNN outlier detection. Default value is 0.95

alpha

(optional) the alpha used for mahalanobis distance outlier detection. Default value is 0.1

ntrees

(optional) the number of trees used in iForest outlier detection. Default value is 100

n

(optional) the number of points to take as outliers in iForest outlier detection. Default value is 5

na.rm

(optional) logical, specifies whether to remove NA values. Defaults to TRUE

Value

method used, dataset used, variables used for outliers detected, indices of any detected outliers, scores for the outliers, and values for optional parameters

Examples

multiOutliers(mtcarsOutliers, method="mahalanobis", alpha=0.1)
#> 
#> ── Summary Information ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#> 
#> Method: mahalanobis
#> Dataset: mtcarsOutliers
#> Variables: mpg cyl disp hp drat wt qsec vs am gear carb scores
#> Row: 5 7 9 10 12 20 31 32
#> Outlier Score: 25.11784 29.58581 27.30969 19.22256 26.99406 21.46034 27.95683 25.39721
#> Message:  Outliers detected
#> Option 1 : alpha = 0.1
#> 
#> ── Dataset Information ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#> 
#> Five Largest Outliers Within the Provided Dataset:
#>                    mpg cyl  disp  hp     drat        wt     qsec        vs am
#> Duster 360    14.30000   8 360.0 245 18.14468  3.570000 15.84000  0.000000  0
#> Maserati Bora 15.00000   8 301.0 335  3.54000  3.570000 33.90273  0.000000  1
#> Merc 230      22.80000   4 140.8  95  3.92000 -4.541341 22.90000 -8.556805  0
#> Merc 450SE    54.17757   8 275.8 180  3.07000  4.070000 17.40000  0.000000  0
#> Volvo 142E    21.40000   4 121.0 109  4.11000  2.780000 18.60000  1.000000  1
#>                    gear      carb   scores
#> Duster 360    3.0000000   4.00000 29.58581
#> Maserati Bora 0.9829575   8.00000 27.95683
#> Merc 230      4.0000000   2.00000 27.30969
#> Merc 450SE    3.0000000   3.00000 26.99406
#> Volvo 142E    4.0000000 -12.91235 25.39721
multiOutliers(mtcarsOutliers, method="LoF", minPts=5)
#> 
#> ── Summary Information ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#> 
#> Method: LoF
#> Dataset: mtcarsOutliers
#> Variables: mpg cyl disp hp drat wt qsec vs am gear carb scores
#> Row: 5 7 9 10 11 12 19 20 29 31 32
#> Outlier Score: 3.146901 4.646142 3.401508 1.759811 2.00213 2.543073 1.915247 1.761172 2.28657 4.403093 1.772691
#> Message:  Outliers detected
#> Option 1 : minPts = 5
#> 
#> ── Dataset Information ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#> 
#> Five Largest Outliers Within the Provided Dataset:
#>                        mpg       cyl  disp      hp     drat        wt     qsec
#> Duster 360        14.30000  8.000000 360.0 245.000 18.14468  3.570000 15.84000
#> Maserati Bora     15.00000  8.000000 301.0 335.000  3.54000  3.570000 33.90273
#> Merc 230          22.80000  4.000000 140.8  95.000  3.92000 -4.541341 22.90000
#> Hornet Sportabout 18.70000 -4.137792 360.0 446.914  3.15000  3.440000 17.02000
#> Merc 450SE        54.17757  8.000000 275.8 180.000  3.07000  4.070000 17.40000
#>                          vs am      gear carb   scores
#> Duster 360         0.000000  0 3.0000000    4 4.646142
#> Maserati Bora      0.000000  1 0.9829575    8 4.403093
#> Merc 230          -8.556805  0 4.0000000    2 3.401508
#> Hornet Sportabout  0.000000  0 3.0000000    2 3.146901
#> Merc 450SE         0.000000  0 3.0000000    3 2.543073
multiOutliers(mtcarsOutliers, method="kNN", k=5, threshold=.95)
#> 
#> ── Summary Information ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#> 
#> Method: kNN
#> Dataset: mtcarsOutliers
#> Variables: mpg cyl disp hp drat wt qsec vs am gear carb scores
#> Row: 11 19
#> Outlier Score: 547.8248 393.1049
#> Message:  Outliers detected
#> Option 1 : k = 5
#> 
#> ── Dataset Information ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#> 
#> Five Largest Outliers Within the Provided Dataset:
#>                        mpg       cyl      disp        hp     drat    wt

#> Honda Civic       30.40000  4.000000  783.2571   52.0000 4.930000 1.615
#> Merc 280          44.30673  6.000000  167.6000 -238.7728 4.560312 3.440
#> Hornet Sportabout 18.70000 -4.137792  360.0000  446.9140 3.150000 3.440
#> Maserati Bora     15.00000  8.000000  301.0000  335.0000 3.540000 3.570
#>                       qsec vs am      gear carb   scores
#> Merc 280C         18.90000  1  0 4.0000000    4 547.8248
#> Honda Civic       18.52000  1  1 4.0000000    2 393.1049
#> Merc 280          18.30000  1  0 4.0000000    4 318.1242
#> Hornet Sportabout 17.02000  0  0 3.0000000    2 189.8207
#> Maserati Bora     33.90273  0  1 0.9829575    8 117.9942
multiOutliers(mtcarsOutliers, method="iForest", ntrees = 50)

#> Option 2 : n = 5
